cell.p:
This Company's system of submarine telegraph
cables is the most direct and quickest means of
communication from Egypt to Europe, North and
South America, East, South and West Africa,
India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan.

To secure quick transmission, telegrams should
be marked Via Eastern.

For latest average time to London, see daily
bulletin in this paper.

Suez, Port-Tewfik, Port-Saïd, Suakin. Head

rainty over Samos. It is thought that France and Russia would not be favourable to union in the near future; the relations between-Italy and Greece are not particularly good, the Italians and the Greeks are rivals in Epirus, and the compulsory recall of the Italian Minister from Athens last spring did not improve the feelings of the two races: Great Britain has no special interest, in hindering, or in hastening, the union, except that, when once the Greeks have Crete, they will demand-Cyprus, which is always regarded by them as an Hellenic island. The most formidable argument in favour of the unión is that no one desires a fresh disturbance in Crete this winter, which would certainly A dead calm appears to prevail for the time call for the intervention of the 'Powers being in Manchuria, and a telegram from Few will be so singuine as to pretend Mukden to-day states that owing to the strength that the Cretans will find amalgama of the respective positions, neither army ap- tion with the Greek Kingdom a complete

TO-DAY'S TELEGRAMS. LOCAL AND GENERAL
THE
WAR.
A STALEMATE.

MUKDEN, November 22. Owing to the strength of the respective positions, neither army appears inclined to attack unless possessing such a preponderance in numbers that they are able to make a flank ing movement. The Japanese probably have the most available troops. (Reuter.)
THE GREEK Aseize COURT at Alexandria will begin its sittings on the 13th December
THE BRINDISI MAIL will be distributed at the GPO, Alexandria, to-morrow morning st 8 o'clock.
MARIOUT RAILWAY.-The Dairs Khasss has bought a large quantity of old material from the Railway Administration for use on the Mariout line.

ter reunions of this society will commence on REUNION DES FAMILLES. The series of win- Saturday, 17th December, with a ball and Xmas Tree. Subsequent balls will be given on January 21, February 25, and April 1 respect ively, the last closing the season.
THE EGYPTIAN GAZETTE, WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 23, 1004
a

NORTH SEA ENQUIRY. THE EVENING EXPRESS. In response to petition presented by the inhabitants of Ram leh to the State Railway Administration, the latter have arranged to stop the evening ex- press train from Cairo at Sidi Gaber, com-
RESPONSIBLE OFFICER ARRIVES.encing from the 19th inst.

THE FRERES CASE-The appeal of M. Yayon against the judgment of the French Consular ST. PETERSBURG, November 22. Tribunal at Cairo, which condemned him to a It is stated that, at the request of Great month's imprisonment for defaming the Con- Britain and Russia, the Emperor of Austria gregation of the Frères, will be heard by the Aix will nominate the fifth member of the Com-Court of Appeal on January 26: mission of Inquiry. (Reuter.)

PARIS, November 22. It is stated here that, at the request, of Great Britain, the Russian officer, of the transport Kamchatka, who first gave the order to open fire on the trawlers, has been landed at Dakar. He will appear before the Commis sion of Inquiry.
(Reuter.)
GENERAL NEWS.
A RUSSIAN RUSE. DESTROYER BOUGHT IN ENGLAND.
LONDON, November 22.

BLIND SCHOOLS-A "bazaar in aid of the blind schools at Alexandria and Tantah will be held at the residence of Mrs. Coventry (which has been kindly lent for the purpose), Mansourah, on Friday next, at 2 p.m. The sale is under the patronage of Mrs. B. Dale.
THE BALTIC FLEET.
DEPARTS FOR PORT SAID.
CANEA, November 22. A division of the Baltic Fleet has left for Port Said. It consists of two battleships, three cruisers, six destroyers, and nine transports. (Reuter.)
As we go to press, we learn that the Baltic morrow morning. Squadron is expected to arrive at Port Said to
Russian Squadron is composed :- The following are the vessels of which the
Battleships: Sissoi Veliki and Navarin Cruisers: Almas and Seietlana. Besuprechy, Buistry, Byjedoci, Braci, Bodri, Torpedo boat destroyers: Blestyaschtchy, and Buini
Volunteer Fleet steamers: Voronej, Tamboe, Vladimir, Kief, and Jarosla Transports: Gortchakof, Juppiter, Kitai,
and Meteor

JAPS AND THE RED SEA. A nautical correspondent writes: in the Red Sea on the look-out for the Russian If the Japanese are lurking about somewhere fleet, the most likely spot for them to be lying Daedalus lighthouse, to the north-east of in waiting is in the neighbourhood of the Berenice. The reefs run out there in every direction and yet one cannot touch bottom in 300 fathoms with deep sea lead. The Japanese could place two torpedo-boats there, one on the east and one on the west of the channel, and they could knock the Russians into a cocked hat at this point.

EGYPTIAN POSTAL ADMINISTRATION-It has been announced by some of our contemporaries that Douglas Morice Bey has been appointed director of the Port Said Post Office in succes-press wires to that paper on the 15th inst. as sion to Mr. Mancantelli: The appointment has follows: not yet been filled up, but it is vacant, as Mr. Mancantelli has been transferred to Alexandria. vessels have arrived here with the intention of It is reported that disguised Japanese war blowing up that portion of the Baltic fleet which will go through the canal. The Russian admiral has cabled to the consulate here to arrange about supplies. Four steamers of the Volunteer fleet which are said to be flying the commercial flag are expected hourly at Port Said. Their names are unknown.

INSURANCE. The "Fidelitas" Assurance Company of Brussels has authorised Messrs. Alf. G. Buhagiar & Co., of Alexandria, to repre- sent it throughout Egypt. This company is one The Standard says that Messrs. (Reuter.)
MACEDORIA EFFECT OF REFORM SCHEME

VIENNA, November 22. According to an official statement issued here, the Austro-Russian reform scheme has greatly improved the general condition of Macedonia. The population itself desires pence. (Router)
CRETE. CERTAINTY OF DISORDERS.

LONDON, November 22, Cin a memorandum by Prince George, handed to the Powers, he emphasizes the certainty of disorders in Crete, if the people's aspirations for the union to Greece are again, rejected.
(Reuter)
GREAT GALE IN NORTH SEA PORTUGUESE ROYALTIES SNOWED UP.
LONDON, November 22.

A great gale is raging in the North Sea There are several wrecks with loss of life Blinding snowstorms are taking place in the North and Midlands of England. The tele graphs are broken, and the trains delayed. The King and Queen of Portugal were mowed mp at Chatsworth, where they are the guests of the Duke of Devonshire.
FRENCH CHAMBER
(Reuter.)
PARIS, November 22. The Chamber of Deputies has rejected the suppression of secret funds. M. Combes had put the question of con
fidence
STRIKE AT LORIENT.
(Havas.)
LORIENT, November 29. The workmen at the powder factories have declared a general strike, and the workmen at Brest areal are joining with them (Havas.)
'AU DE ROUGE.'
now quoted.

THE AMERICAN ANNUAL NATIONAL THANKS- GIVING will be observed to-morrow (Thursday). In recognition of this anniversary, & service will be held at 11 o'clock to-morrow in the American Mission Church, Cairo, near Shep- heard's Hotel: Residents and visitors are cordially invited to participate in this service.

SURZ CANAL-On the 19th and 20th inst. 33 vessels passed through the Suez Canal. Of these, 24 were British, 2 French, 4 German, Dutch, 1 Austrian, and I Portuguese. The transit and passenger dues for the two days amounted to 884,032.02 fra. The total transit and passenger dues collected from the 1st to that date on 298 vessels amounted to 6,612,139.09 frs.
THE KHEDIVE.
The Khedive is spending to day at Mariout, where he is inspecting his estates. His Highness will return to Montazah in the evening.
EGYPTIAN STATE DOMAIN.

Masar, M. M. Rothschild and fortune that Egyptian State Domain Mortgage bonds to the amount of £20,220 nominal capital have been drawn for payment at par on December 1. The drawing consists of all bonds (not pre- viously cancelled by the operation of the sinking fand) comprised in the series of numbers advert ised.
ELEMENTARY EDUCATION.

About a thousand children of the employés of the Egyptian Railway Administration are without any means of obtaining any education whatsoever. The Board has now decided in principle to pay a few fikis, who will begin the work of instructing the progeny of platelayers
and others.
YACHTING
The British turbine yacht Emerald sailed from Alexandria harbour yesterday, bound North The steam yacht Catarina is now at Port Said, and leaves for Suez in a day or two
STEAMER MOVEMENTS.
The Moss liner Moeris arrived at Liverpool 11 on Monday afternoon.
General Drapery Establishment. (Central Tramway station), CAIRO. P. PLUNKETT,
PROPRIETOR.
The Khedivial Mail 8.8. Dakaklich will leave Alexandria on Saturday and Port Said on Sunday for Beyrout, Tripoli, Mersin, Alexandretta, Larnaca, Limassol, Caiffs, and Jaffa.
BRITISH CRUISER AT SUEZ Suez, Tuesday-As wired to-day, H.M.'s second-class cruiser. For arrived at Suez this morning from the East Indies.
She will change her crew with that brought

PUNITIVE EXPEDITION IN SUDAN. The War Office issued the following state- ment to the Press yesterday:

On the 10th ult. a patrol left El Obeid for Rahad, under the command of Miralai O'Con- sell Bey, to proceed against Abou Zeida of Kitra, who had expelled the Mek appointed by the Moudir of Kordofan last April and usurped his authority.
P. W. D. CONTRACTS.
The Ministry of Public Works has given out the contracts for the winter cleansing works in
the canals as follows:-
Assiout-Mr. Sturgess Galioabieh.-1 and II. groups, Khalil Chahin. Chaker; 3. Moh. Ali Wanis. Dakahlieh.-Group 1., Messrs. Bellini; 2. S.

Markas Abnoub-C. Passaris.

ALHAMBRA THEATRE
Un Ballo in Maschera was successfully given yesterday evening. Tonight, Rigoletto, will be given, with the tenor Apostolou.
To-morrow Cavalleria Rusticana and I Pa gliacci will be staged, and on Friday Verdi's
The native Press announces the death of Mohamed Bay lakander, son of Soliman Pasha El Franssoni (Colonel Seves), late Minister of War. The deceased was 60 years of age.
Dr. Gottheil, professor at Columbia Univer sity, has left the Carlton Hotel, Balkaley, and is now staying at Shepheard's

Après Jure restés longtemps stationnaieston having seen thrown upon the market and rés à 7 environ, les Cotton Mills viennent de monter subitement à 9/9 acheteurs. O a4changé ce matin 6 à 7,000 titres.
En husse également la Ward an à 8 1/8 acheteurs, les Markets à 27/3 acheteurs, les Esux d'Alexandrie à 17 1/8 et les Esax du Caire à 1125 achetears.

Par contre on fléchit légèrement sur 1s Crown Brewery do 232 à 230, sot l'Anglo Ameriein Nile de 5-3/8 5 5/16 acheteurs et sur les Privilégiées Tramwaya d'Alexan- dris de 147 1/2 146 1/2 acheteurs. Lea Dividendes sont demandées à 386.
